string.text: Вядома, калі ласка, сядайце.
Да мяне зьвярнуўся землеўласьнік, які жадаў наняць кагосьці дзеля будаўніцтва абарончых умацаваньняў для свайго маёнтку.

Ён прапанаваў мне вялікую суму грошаў за працу, але падчас блізкага разгляду я зразумеў, што ўмацаваньне будзе выкарыстоўвацца, каб не пускаць у яго бедных і няўдалых чальцоў грамадства. Я ня мог з чыстым сумленьнем браць удзел у такой справе.

Я меў выбар паміж згодай на гэтую працу і вялікай сумай грошаў ці адмовай ад прапановы дзеля захаваньня сваіх прынцыпаў. Я вырашыў адмовіцца ад прапановы і працягнуць пошук працы, якая б адпавядала маім поглядам на жыцьцё.
Вы вынайшлі шляхетны вынахад. Трэба валодаць вялікай адвагай, каб адстойваць свае перакананьні і адмовіцца ад працы з такой вялікай узнагародай.
Вы мусілі згадзіцца на гэтую працу, бо на заробленыя грошы было льга дапамагчы большай колькасьці людзей. Вашыя поглядыць ня вінны быць перашкодай дзеля дапамогі іншым.
Я апынуўся ў гэтай карчме, бо гэта вядомае месца, і я спадзяюся знайсьці тое, што адпавядаем маім поглядам.
Я дасьведчаны інжынер и добра валодаю арбалетам. Трымаюся вучэньняў Махізма, які падкрэсьлівае важнасьць усеагульнай любві, спачуваньня і спрыяньня сацыяльнаму дабрабыту.
Я вандроўца, што шукае працу. Я добра падрыхтаваны пяхотны, здольны змагацца як у блізкім боі, гэтак і ў далёкім.
Я падарожнічаў па зямле ў пошуках працы найміта. Я толькі скончыў працу па абароне гандлёвага каравана ад грабежнікаў і прыбыў сюды, каб адпачыць і адсьвяткаваць свой посьпех.

Мяне наняў заможны гандляр дзеля абароны свайго гандлёвага каравана ад грабежнікаў. Гандляр прапанаваў мне шмат золата, але падчас падарожжа я даведаўся, што ён эксплуатуе беднякоў і карыстаецца іх галечай. Я сустрэў маральную дылему: працягнуць працу і бараніць багацьце гандляра ці кінуць яго і адмоваіцца ўва ўдзеле ў ганебнай справе.

Я вырашыў давесьці справу да канца, бо можа, я і ня згодны з метадамі гандляра, але тое была мая праца - бараніць караван, і я яе выканаў. Я стараюся зьвесьці да мінімума страты падчас нападу бандытаў і бараніць нявінных, наколькі гэта магчыма. Мне заплацілі, і цяпер я атрымліваю асалоду ад плёнаў сваёй працы тут, у гэтай карчме.
Я захапляюся вашай здольнасьцю прымаць хуткія вынахады, вы дакладна ведаеце як дзеяць у складаных абставінах.
Я ня згодны з вашымі дзеяньнямі, як найміт можа мець маральны компас і не ўдзельнічаць у чымсьці ганеным.

Я тут жыву дзеля заробку на жыцьцё, і не ўхілюся ад выкананьня любога заданьня, якім бы небясьпечным яно ні было, абы мне за яго заплацілі. І, дарэчы, калі вы ведаеце, што трэба рабіць, я вашы чалавек.
Я добра падрыхтаваны пяхотны, што валодае навыкамі блізкага і далёкага бою і шукае працу.
Sure why not.
'The Unfilial', it's a title I earned for doing what needed to be done for my family.
I left my home and joined the army as a horse archer, my pay sent home to support my family. The cost of filial piety.
War ended, so did my income. Now I'm just another veteran looking for a new way to make a living. And maybe a stiff drink to numb the memories.
I can see how much your family means to you, your choice to support them shows your filial piety.
I understand that you wanted to help your family, but I believe there are other ways to support them without putting yourself in danger and leaving them.
Yeah, we'll see. Life never gives you what you want, only what you need.
I'm a horse archer, Looking for any kind of work that pays, it's not like I have any choice or preference, I just need to survive.
Yes of course.

Recently, I was hired by a local lord to quell a rebellion in a neighboring province. The rebellion was led by a former general who had grown discontent with the lord's rule. I lead my men into battle against the rebel forces. We were outnumbered, but I knew that we had the advantage in training and equipment.

During the battle, I was faced with a moral choice. One of the rebel leaders, a former friend of mine, had been captured by my men. He begged for mercy, but I knew that if I showed him mercy, he would only return to fight against us again.
I had to make a difficult decision, but in the end, I chose to uphold my duty to my lord and put him to death.
I support your decision to put the rebel leader to death. He posed a threat to the stability of the province and it was necessary to eliminate him in order to ensure the safety of the people.

I am against your decision to put the rebel leader to death. He may have had valid reasons for his rebellion and killing him only perpetuates the cycle of violence. There may have been a chance for reconciliation and peace.

After the battle, I returned to the lord's castle, where I was rewarded for my service. I spent the night at the tavern, as it was a place where I could relax and celebrate with my men. And now I'm here looking for new work.
I am looking for any work that requires my skills as a warrior and leader. I am not picky, as long as the pay is fair and the cause is just.
Ah, well that's an interesting story.
I was on the lookout for work, as I'm in need of coin. I came across a village that was being terrorized by bandits. The villagers offered to pay me to take care of the problem.

I agreed, and we set out to find the bandits' hideout. But when we got there, we found that the bandits were actually just a group of desperate farmers who had turned to banditry to feed their families.
It was a tough decision, but I chose to let them go and bring them back to the village to negotiate a fair deal with the villagers.
I think it was a very noble decision to let the bandits go and try to find a peaceful solution for the villagers. It shows that you have a strong sense of justice and compassion.

I think you made a mistake by letting the bandits go. They were criminals and needed to be dealt with accordingly. Your generosity has put the village in danger and your actions may have caused more harm than good.

After that little adventure, I decided to take a break and have a pint or two at the local tavern. I'm always on the lookout for new work, but I'm not too picky. I'll take on just about anything as long as it pays well and doesn't involve hurting innocent people.
I am looking for any work that requires my skills as a warrior and leader. I am not picky, as long as the pay is fair and the cause is just.
Ah, yeah sure.
I was once hired by a wealthy merchant to protect his caravan as it traveled through bandit-infested territory. During the journey, we were ambushed by a group of bandits.
In the heat of battle, I let my berserker side take over and I went a bit crazy. In the end, we were victorious, but the bandit leader begged for mercy. I had a choice to make, kill him or spare him.

I decided to spare him, but in the end, he ended up betraying us and leading the bandits to attack us again. We were able to defeat them once more, but it was a costly victory. I learned that sometimes mercy can be a weakness.
I think your choice to spare the bandit leader was the right one. It shows that you have a sense of honor and compassion, even in the heat of battle.

I disagree with your decision to spare the bandit leader. It ultimately led to more harm and danger for you and the caravan. It's important to remember that in certain situations, mercy can be a liability.
After the caravan job, I needed a place to rest and recuperate. I heard about this tavern and decided to check it out. I am currently resting here and looking for my next job opportunity.
I am looking for work as a mercenary or bodyguard. I am skilled in battle and have a bit of a wild side, so I am well suited for those types of jobs.
Why not
Recently, I was hired by a wealthy merchant to escort a valuable cargo across treacherous terrain. Along the way, we were ambushed by bandits. I was faced with a difficult moral choice

- to prioritize the safety of the merchant and the cargo, or to risk it all to save the lives of the innocent villagers who were also being attacked by the bandits. I made the decision to prioritize the safety of the merchant and the cargo, as that was my primary responsibility.

However, I also made sure to eliminate the bandits as quickly and efficiently as possible to minimize the harm to the villagers. Ultimately, we were able to successfully deliver the cargo and the villagers were able to fend off the bandits.
I think you made the right choice. The safety of the merchant and the cargo is important, and you were able to eliminate the bandits and minimize harm to the villagers.
I disagree with your decision. The lives of innocent villagers should have been a priority, and the safety of the merchant's goods should not have been more important.

After completing the job, the merchant was pleased with my work and recommended me to others. I have been traveling and taking on various jobs, and I am currently resting in this tavern before moving on to my next job.

I am a horse archer and a skilled scout. I am open to any work that pays well and allows me to put my skills to use. I am particularly interested in working for wealthy merchants or powerful lords as a bodyguard or mercenary.
No problem
One scenario that comes to mind was when I was leading a group of soldiers in battle. Our enemy had taken hostages, and they threatened to kill them if we did not retreat.

I had to weigh the lives of the hostages against the success of our mission and the lives of my own soldiers. In the end, I made the decision to continue the attack, and unfortunately, the hostages were killed.
It was a difficult and tragic choice, but it ultimately led to our victory.
I think you made the right choice. The safety of the merchant and the cargo is important, and you were able to eliminate the bandits and minimize harm to the villagers.
I disagree with your decision. The lives of innocent villagers should have been a priority, and the safety of the merchant's goods should not have been more important.
Afterwards, I retired to a tavern, feeling the weight of my decision, but also knowing that I had made the best choice for the success of my mission and for the safety of my soldiers.

I am a berserker and a great commander. I am open to most any kind of work, as long as it is challenging and pays well. I have experience in battle, strategy, and leadership, so I am well-suited for roles such as a mercenary or a bodyguard.
Well, let me tell you, I have many stories to share.

One of the most recent and notable ones was when I was hired by a wealthy merchant to escort his daughter to a neighboring kingdom for an arranged marriage. Along the way, we were ambushed by bandits. I was able to fend them off, but the merchant's daughter was gravely injured.

I had to make a choice: I could either continue on our journey and deliver her to her intended husband, or I could stay with her and tend to her wounds. I chose to stay and heal her, and as a result, we missed the wedding.
The merchant was furious and did not pay me for my services. But my honor and my duty as a healer were more important to me than any gold.
I completely understand and support your decision to stay and heal the merchant's daughter. Your sense of honor and duty as a healer is commendable.
While I understand your reasoning, I think it was a mistake to stay and miss the wedding. The merchant's financial loss and anger is a significant consequence.
And now, I am here, looking for new opportunities and possibly, new adventures, especially if they include charming company such as yourself.
I am a wanderer, seeking work as an archer, scout, and healer. What brings you to this tavern? Are you perhaps in need of someone like me, someone who can protect and defend you?
I have many stories.
I was on my way to a nearby town to inquire about potential job opportunities when I came across a group of bandits attacking a merchant caravan.
I intervened and helped fend off the bandits, but not before they had caused significant damage. I couldn't just stand there and watch innocent people getting robbed and hurt.
I stepped in and fought alongside the merchants. We were able to drive the bandits off and recover the stolen goods.
I think it was a brave and honorable choice to intervene and help the merchants. Your actions showed true valor and generosity.
I disagree with your decision to get involved in the bandits' attack. It could have put you in unnecessary danger and could have potentially led to a worse outcome for all parties involved.

The merchants were grateful and offered to buy me a meal and a room at the nearest tavern as a token of their appreciation. I accepted their offer and decided to stay for the night and continue my journey in the morning.

I am a wanderer, looking for work. I am skilled in combat and comfortable with the shady and dark dealings. I am particularly interested in jobs that involve protecting caravans or escorting important figures. I also have experience in investigating and solving disputes. I'm not afraid of going into dangerous situations as long as it's for a good cause.
The past a puzzle, and the future a riddle.
I have been presented with many opportunities, but none as intriguing as the one I declined. I was offered a seat among the elite, but it was not meant to be mine.

I have uncovered their hidden truths, and I have wielded them, but at a great cost. I had to disappear, to become a new person, but they still seek me out. But I am elusive, like the shadow in the night.
Now, I wander, like a leaf in the wind, seeking new mysteries and new opportunities. The road ahead is long and winding, and the choices I make will shape my destiny.
You made the right choice, standing up for what's right takes courage.
I don't agree with your choice, it seems too risky, and also it seem you're hiding something.
And now, I find myself in this tavern, where paths cross and destinies intertwine.
The future is a riddle, and I am eager to unravel it, I am ever ready to make choices that will shape my destiny.
